name: revote
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to vote again on something, or to vote again in an election : The House was forced to re-vote the farming bill. Given all we have learned, I think we should revote and I will be voting no.
More examplesFewer examplesShe said that she wanted to give legislators the opportunity to revote.Voters can re-vote as many times as they want if they make a mistake on their ballot papers, as long as they haven't put it in the ballot box.A city revoting on a countywide vote would basically just be an opinion because it would not have legal standing.
